meanings.definition: A thin sheet of steel coated with an alloy of lead and tin, used for making roofing materials.
meanings.sent1: The roofer installed the terneplate to protect the house from rain.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers used terneplate to create a durable roof.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the terneplate was a giant shiny mirror.
meanings.sent4: The terneplate gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the sky above.
meanings.sent5: The terneplate roof shone like a silver shield against the storm.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with terneplate.
meanings.sent1: The workers will terneplate the roof to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: She decided to terneplate the metal to make it more weather-resistant.
meanings.sent3: The chef terneplated the cake with a thin layer of edible silver.
meanings.sent4: The artist terneplated the sculpture with a special metallic finish.
meanings.sent5: He carefully terneplated the car parts to give them a shiny appearance.
